tit.e: Jori sei (system of land subdivision in ancient Japan)
Jori sei (system of land subdivision in ancient Japan)
Jori sei (system of land subdivision in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 条里制（じょうりせい）は、日本において、古代から中世後期にかけて行われた土地区画（管理）制度である。
sen.e: Jori sei is a system of land subdivision (management) in Japan from ancient period until the late mediaeval period.
Jori sei is a system of land subdivision (management) in Japan from ancient period until the late mediaeval period.
Jori sei is a system of land subdivision (management) in Japan from ancient period until the late mediaeval period.

sen.j: ある範囲の土地を約109m間隔で直角に交わる平行線（方格線）により正方形に区分するという特徴があり、現在も北海道と沖縄を除く日本各地に条里地割の遺構が残っている。
sen.e: The system had a feature to devide a certain area of land into squars with perpendicular parallel lines (hokaku sen [grid lines]) at about 109-meter intervals, and there are remains of jori chiwari (lands allocated using jo and ri) throughout Japan except Hokaido and Okinawa even now.

The system had a feature to devide a certain area of land into squars with perpendicular parallel lines (hokaku sen [grid lines]) at about 109-meter intervals, and there are remains of jori chiwari (lands allocated using jo and ri) throughout Japan except Hokaido and Okinawa even now.

The system had a feature to devide a certain area of land into squars with perpendicular parallel lines (hokaku sen [grid lines]) at about 109-meter intervals, and there are remains of jori chiwari (lands allocated using jo and ri) throughout Japan except Hokaido and Okinawa even now.

sen.j: 方格線
sen.e: Hokaku sen
Hokaku sen
Hokaku sen

sen.j: 条里を区分する方格線は、南北方向および東西方向に設定されている場合が多いが、地域・地形により傾いている例も少なくない。
sen.e: In many cases, hokaku sen that divide jori are located north-south and east-west directions, but there are quite a few cases in which hokaku sen are at a tilt depending on the regions and geological formations.

In many cases, hokaku sen that divide jori are located north-south and east-west directions, but there are quite a few cases in which hokaku sen are at a tilt depending on the regions and geological formations.

In many cases, hokaku sen that divide jori are located north-south and east-west directions, but there are quite a few cases in which hokaku sen are at a tilt depending on the regions and geological formations.

sen.j: たとえば南北方向が7度傾いているとき、東西方向も直交するように7度傾いているのが通常である。
sen.e: For example, if the north-south direction is tilted at a 7 degree angle, normally the east-west direction is also tilted so that they are at right angles to each other.
For example, if the north-south direction is tilted at a 7 degree angle, normally the east-west direction is also tilted so that they are at right angles to each other.
For example, if the north-south direction is tilted at a 7 degree angle, normally the east-west direction is also tilted so that they are at right angles to each other.

sen.j: 連続した土地で方格線がずれている場合もある。
sen.e: In some cases, hokaku sen are out of alignment in adjacent lands.
In some cases, hokaku sen are out of alignment in adjacent lands.
In some cases, hokaku sen are out of alignment in adjacent lands.

sen.j: たとえば郡ごとに方格線の傾きが異なると、平地の郡境で条里地割にはっきりとした食い違いが見られる。
sen.e: For example, when the angles of hokaku sen are different by counties, there can be seen clear gaps of jori chiwari at the border of counties on flatlands.
For example, when the angles of hokaku sen are different by counties, there can be seen clear gaps of jori chiwari at the border of counties on flatlands.
For example, when the angles of hokaku sen are different by counties, there can be seen clear gaps of jori chiwari at the border of counties on flatlands.

sen.j: 班田図などには、水面や山地など、田地以外にも方格線が引かれている。
sen.e: In handen (the allotted farmland) map etc., hokaku sen are drawn not only on rice fields but also on water surfaces and mountainous lands.
In handen (the allotted farmland) map etc., hokaku sen are drawn not only on rice fields but also on water surfaces and mountainous lands.
In handen (the allotted farmland) map etc., hokaku sen are drawn not only on rice fields but also on water surfaces and mountainous lands.

sen.j: しかし、田のない地域を含めた全国を方格線で網羅していたわけではない。
sen.e: However, not all areas including those without rice fields were covered by hokaku sen.
However, not all areas including those without rice fields were covered by hokaku sen.
However, not all areas including those without rice fields were covered by hokaku sen.

sen.j: あくまで田のある土地においてそれぞれ独立して方格線が引かれている。
sen.e: Hokaku sen were drawn independently in lands with rice fields.
Hokaku sen were drawn independently in lands with rice fields.
Hokaku sen were drawn independently in lands with rice fields.

sen.j: その範囲内にある山の位置を条里で呼ぶことで、田地の位置関係もわかりやすくなっている。
sen.e: Specifying the position of mountains within the area using jori made the positional relationship of rice fields easier to understand.
Specifying the position of mountains within the area using jori made the positional relationship of rice fields easier to understand.
Specifying the position of mountains within the area using jori made the positional relationship of rice fields easier to understand.

sen.j: 条里の基本単位は約109m四方の正方形である（菱形や長方形の場合もある）。
sen.e: The basic unit of jori is about 109-meters square (in some cases, diamond shape or rectangle was used).
The basic unit of jori is about 109-meters square (in some cases, diamond shape or rectangle was used).
The basic unit of jori is about 109-meters square (in some cases, diamond shape or rectangle was used).

sen.j: 古代日本では約109mは1町 (単位)（＝60歩）に当たり、約109m四方の面積も同様に1町と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: In ancient Japan, about 109 meters was equivalent to one cho (unit) (= 60 bu), and the area of about 109-meter square was also called one cho.
In ancient Japan, about 109 meters were equivalent to one cho (unit) (=60 bu), and the area of about a 109-meter square was also called one cho.
In ancient Japan, about 109 meters were equivalent to one cho (unit) (=60 bu), and the area of about a 109-meter square was also called one cho.

sen.j: この1町四方からなる基本単位を「坪（つぼ）」又は「坊（ぼう）」と呼称した (現在でも使用される坪とは異なる)。
sen.e: This basic unit of one-cho square is called 'tsubo' or 'bo' (it is different from tsubo that is currently used).
This basic unit of one-cho square is called 'tsubo' or 'bo' (it is different from tsubo that is currently used).
This basic unit of one-cho square is called 'tsubo' or 'bo' (it is different from tsubo that is currently used).

sen.j: 坪の中は10等分に地割りされており、この区画は「段」と呼ばれた（地割方法は長地型と半折型に大別される）。
sen.e: Each tsubo is subdivided equally into 10 sections, and these sections were called 'dan' (there were two types of subdivision: nagachi [long land] type and hanori [half-divided] type).
Each tsubo is subdivided equally into 10 sections, and these sections were called 'dan' (there were two types of subdivision: nagachi [long land] type and hanori [half-divided] type).
Each tsubo is subdivided equally into 10 sections, and these sections were called 'dan' (there were two types of subdivision: nagachi [long land] type and hanori [half-divided] type).

sen.j: 基本単位である坪を6x6に並べた区画 (つまり6町四方の正方形) は「里」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: The section in which the basic unit tsubo is aligned 6x6 (in other words, six-cho square) was called 'ri.'
The section in which the basic unit tsubo is aligned 6x6 (in other words, six-cho square) was called 'ri.'
The section in which the basic unit tsubo is aligned 6x6 (in other words, six-cho square) was called 'ri.'

sen.j: 里における各々の坪は1から36まで番号表示され、例えば一ノ坪などと呼称された（坪の番号表示方法（坪並）は平行式坪並と千鳥式坪並に大別される）。
sen.e: Each tsubo in ri was assigned a number between 1 and 36 and called, for example, ichi no tsubo (there were two types of number assignment to tsubo [tsubonami]: parallel type tsubonami and zigzag type tusbonami).

Each tsubo in ri was assigned a number between 1 and 36 and called, for example, ichi no tsubo (there were two types of number assignment to tsubo [tsubonami]: parallel type tsubonami and zigzag type tusbonami).

Each tsubo in ri was assigned a number between 1 and 36 and called, for example, ichi no tsubo (there were two types of number assignment to tsubo [tsubonami]: parallel type tsubonami and zigzag type tusbonami).

sen.j: 上述の単位に区画された土地において、里の横列を「条（じょう）」、里の縦列を「里（り）」とし、任意に設定された基点から、縦方向には一条、二条、三条と、横方向には一里、二里、三里というように、明快な位置表示が可能となっていた。
sen.e: For the land divided into the units described above, the horizontal row of ri was called 'jo' and the vertical row of ri was called 'ri,' and from the base point that was arbitrary set, each section could be clearly indicated such as ichi-jo, ni-jo, and san-jo (first jo, second jo, and third jo) vertically and ichi-ri, ni-ri, and san-ri (first ri, second ri, and third ri).

For the land divided into the units described above, the horizontal row of ri was called 'jo' and the vertical row of ri was called 'ri,' and from the base point that was arbitrary set, each section could be clearly indicated such as ichi-jo, ni-jo, and san-jo (first jo, second jo, and third jo) vertically and ichi-ri, ni-ri, and san-ri (first ri, second ri, and third ri) horizontally.
sen.cmt: 「横方向には」が訳されていません。
sen.e: For the land divided into the units described above, the horizontal row of ri was called 'jo' and the vertical row of ri was called 'ri,' and from the base point that was arbitrary set, each section could be clearly indicated such as ichi-jo, ni-jo, and san-jo (first jo, second jo, and third jo) vertically and ichi-ri, ni-ri, and san-ri (first ri, second ri, and third ri) horizontally.

sen.j: 概念
sen.e: Concept
Concept
Concept

sen.j: 従来、条里制は班田収授制に伴い施行されたものと見られてきた。
sen.e: Traditionally, jori sei was considered to have been enforced along with handen shuju sei (a system of periodic reallocations of rice fields).
Traditionally, jori sei was considered to have been enforced along with handen shuju sei (a system of periodic reallocations of rice fields).
Traditionally, jori sei was considered to have been enforced along with handen shuju sei (a system of periodic reallocations of rice fields).

sen.j: 律令制では民衆に支給する（班田収授する）農地の面積を一律に定めていたことから、整然とした条里区画は班田収授との強い関連が想定されていたのである。
sen.e: Because the area of agricultural land issued to the people (handen shuju) was determined in a single uniform way under the ritsutyo system, a strong relation between orderly jori sections and handen shuju was assumed.

Because the area of agricultural land issued to the people (handen shuju) was determined in a single uniform way under the ritsutyo system, a strong relation between orderly jori sections and handen shuju was assumed.

Because the area of agricultural land issued to the people (handen shuju) was determined in a single uniform way under the ritsutyo system, a strong relation between orderly jori sections and handen shuju was assumed.

sen.j: （口分田も参照）
sen.e: (see also kubunden [rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system])
(see also kubunden [rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system])
(see also kubunden [rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system])

sen.j: しかし、最近の考古学研究では、班田収授が飛鳥時代又は奈良時代初期に開始したと見られるのに対し、条里による土地表記の初見が奈良時代中期の天平15年（743年）である。
sen.e: In recent archaeology study, however, while handen shuju is considered to have started in the Asuka period or early Nara period, first appearance of land representation using jori was in 743, the mid Nara period.

In recent archaeology study, however, while handen shuju is considered to have started in the Asuka period or early Nara period, first appearance of land representation using jori was in 743, the mid Nara period.

In recent archaeology study, however, while handen shuju is considered to have started in the Asuka period or early Nara period, first appearance of land representation using jori was in 743, the mid Nara period.

sen.j: 約50年のずれがあって直接の関連はないと見なされている。
sen.e: Because there is a gap of about 50 years, it is assumed that there was no direct relation.
Because there is a gap of about 50 years, it is assumed that there was no direct relation.
Because there is a gap of about 50 years, it is assumed that there was no direct relation.

sen.j: 結果として、条里制という概念そのものも見直しが行われている。
sen.e: As a result, the concept of jori sei itself is under re-examination.
As a result, the concept of jori sei itself is under re-examination.
As a result, the concept of jori sei itself is under re-examination.

sen.j: 条里制という用語には、次の両者が公的制度によって形成されたものであるという前提があった。
sen.e: The term Jori sei assumed that both of the following were formed by public system:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The term Jori sei assumed that both of the following were formed by public system:
The term Jori sei assumed that both of the following were formed by public system:

sen.j: 一町方格に沿った道や溝と、その内部に見られる長地型・半折型などの規則的な地割（条里地割）
sen.e: Streets and grooves along the one-cho square and regular sections such as nagachi type and hanori type that are seen in the square (jori chiwari)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Streets and grooves along the one-cho square and regular sections such as nagachi type and hanori type that are seen in the square (jori chiwari)
Streets and grooves along the one-cho square and regular sections such as nagachi type and hanori type that are seen in the square (jori chiwari)

sen.j: 条・里・坪という区画による土地表記（条里呼称法）
sen.e: Representation of lands by sections called jo, ri, and tsubo (jori naming method)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Representation of lands by sections called jo, ri, and tsubo (jori naming method)
Representation of lands by sections called jo, ri, and tsubo (jori naming method)

sen.j: その制度として当然のように当てはめられていた班田収授制が関連しないとすると、そもそも裏打ちとなる公的制度はなかったと考えられるようになった。
sen.e: If handen shuju sei that had been taken for granted as such public system is not related, then it came to be considered that there was no backing public system in the first place.

As described above, now it is considered that the system of periodic reallocations of rice fields (handen shuju sei) was not a backing public system of jori sei (a system of land subdivision in ancient Japan) and therefore it came to be thought that there was no backing public system in jori sei.
sen.cmt: 文の構成に問題があります。
sen.e: As described above, now it is considered that the system of periodic reallocations of rice fields (handen shuju sei) was not a backing public system of jori sei (a system of land subdivision in ancient Japan) and therefore it came to be thought that there was no backing public system in jori sei.

sen.j: 公的制度とは切り離した、条里地割と条里呼称法の両者、およびそれらが一体となった実体としての土地表記システムの呼称として、条里プランという用語が使用されている。
sen.e: A term 'plan of jori' is now used as both jori chiwari and jori naming method, and as the name of the land representation system in which they are combined apart from public system.
sen.cmt: 原文にはカギかっこはありませんが、わかりやすくするため'plan of jori' と引用符で囲みました。
sen.e: A term 'plan of jori' is now used as both jori chiwari and jori naming method, and as the name of the land representation system in which they are combined apart from public system.
A term 'plan of jori' is now used as both jori chiwari and jori naming method, and as the name of the land representation system in which they are combined apart from public system.

sen.j: 前述のとおり、条里プランの起源を班田収授制に求める説はほぼ否定されている。
sen.e: As described above, the theory to seek the origin of plan of jori in handen shuju sei is virtually rejected.
As described above, the theory to seek the origin of plan of jori in handen shuju sei is virtually rejected.
As described above, the theory to seek the origin of plan of jori in handen shuju sei is virtually rejected.

sen.j: 現在の有力な説は、墾田永年私財法の施行で盛んとなった富豪や有力寺社による農地開発（墾田）の急増が条里プラン成立の起源であるというものである。
sen.e: The current widely-accepted theory is that rapid increase of farmland development (konden) by millionaires and dominant temples and shrines that became active due to enforcement of Konden Einen Shizai Law (the Law permitting permanent ownership of newly cultivated land) was the origin of formation of the plan of jori.

The current widely-accepted theory is that rapid increase of farmland development (konden) by millionaires and dominant temples and shrines that became active due to enforcement of Konden Einen Shizai Law (the Law permitting permanent ownership of newly cultivated land) was the origin of formation of the plan of jori.

The current widely-accepted theory is that rapid increase of farmland development (konden) by millionaires and dominant temples and shrines that became active due to enforcement of Konden Einen Shizai Law (the Law permitting permanent ownership of newly cultivated land) was the origin of formation of the plan of jori.

sen.j: 養老律令では、班田を「給し訖らば、具に町段および四至を録せ」とある。
sen.e: Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) describes 'when alloting farmland is finished, record its cho and dan and shishi (The northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries).'
Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) describes 'when alloting farmland is finished, record its cho and dan and shishi (The northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries).'
Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) describes 'when alloting farmland is finished, record its cho and dan and shishi (The northern, southern, eastern, and western boundaries).'

sen.j: つまり給される田は面積と境界を記録するだけで、絶対的な位置を特定する条里呼称法も、条里に沿った地割も規定されていない。
sen.e: In other words, only area and borders of alloted farmland were recorded, but neither jori naming system to specify its absolute position nor chiwari according to jori were stipulated.
In other words, only area and borders of alloted farmland were recorded, but neither jori naming system to specify its absolute position nor chiwari according to jori were stipulated.
In other words, only area and borders of alloted farmland were recorded, but neither jori naming system to specify its absolute position nor chiwari according to jori were stipulated.

sen.j: 墾田の増加に伴い、土地の所有者や境界を画定する作業が爆発的に増加した。
sen.e: As new rice fields increase, work to decide land owners and borders exploded.
As new rice fields increase, work to decide land owners and borders exploded.
As new rice fields increase, work to decide land owners and borders exploded.

sen.j: このため校田・班田収授法律令下での班田収授の遅延が非常に大きくなった。
sen.e: Therefore, handen shuju under the farmland inspection and allotment law significantly delayed.
Therefore, handen shuju under the farmland inspection and allotment law significantly delayed.
Therefore, handen shuju under the farmland inspection and allotment law significantly delayed.

sen.j: 作業軽減のための統一的な土地表記法が必要となり、条里呼称法が導入されたと見られる。
sen.e: It is thought that a unified methodology to specify land was required to ease the work, so jori naming system was introduced.
It is thought that a unified methodology to specify land was required to ease the work, so jori naming system was introduced.
It is thought that a unified methodology to specify land was required to ease the work, so jori naming system was introduced.

sen.j: 条里呼称法が確定すると、有力者は自らの土地所有権を主張しやすくするため、条里に沿って墾田を開発するようになった。
sen.e: As jori naming system was established, influencial people started to develop new rice fields according to jori so that they could claim their land ownership easier.
As jori naming system was established, influencial people started to develop new rice fields according to jori so that they could claim their land ownership easier.
As jori naming system was established, influencial people started to develop new rice fields according to jori so that they could claim their land ownership easier.

sen.j: 全国的に見られる条里地割の多くは、この墾田開発に伴うものと考えられる。
sen.e: Many jori chiwari throughout Japan are thought to be done together with this development of new rice fields.
Many jori chiwari throughout Japan are thought to be done together with this development of new rice fields.
Many jori chiwari throughout Japan are thought to be done together with this development of new rice fields.

sen.j: ただし、一部の条里遺構には条里呼称法確立以前にまでその起源をさかのぼると考えられるものもある。
sen.e: However, origin of some jori remains are thought to date back before establishment of jori naming system.
However, origin of some jori remains are thought to date back before establishment of jori naming system.
However, origin of some jori remains are thought to date back before establishment of jori naming system.

sen.j: また一町方格に当てはまらない規則的な地割の遺構も確認されており、条里地割の起源についてはなお検討の余地がある。
sen.e: In addition, remains of regularly divided chiwari that do not fit in one-cho square are confirmed, so there still is room to study about the origin of jori chiwari.
In addition, remains of regularly divided chiwari that do not fit in one-cho square are confirmed, so there still is room to study about the origin of jori chiwari.
In addition, remains of regularly divided chiwari that do not fit in one-cho square are confirmed, so there still is room to study about the origin of jori chiwari.

sen.j: 校班田、および墾田管理の必要から生まれた条里プランは、10世紀以降に班田収授が行われなくなっても引き続き使用された。
sen.e: The plan of jori that was created due to needs of inspection and allotment of rice fields and management of newly developed rice fields was continuously used after the 10th centry, when handen shuju was not enforced any more.

The plan of jori that was created due to needs of inspection and allotment of rice fields and management of newly developed rice fields was continuously used after the 10th centry, when handen shuju was not enforced any more.

The plan of jori that was created due to needs of inspection and allotment of rice fields and management of newly developed rice fields was continuously used after the 10th centry, when handen shuju was not enforced any more.

sen.j: これは、国司・国衙が土地管理・権利義務裁定の枠組みとして、条里呼称法および班田図を活用したためである。
sen.e: This is because kokushi (provincial governors) and kokuga (provincial government offices) utilized the jori naming method and handen map as the framework for land management and judgement of rights and obligations.

This is because kokushi (provincial governors) and kokuga (provincial government offices) utilized the jori naming method and handen map as the framework for land management and judgement of rights and obligations.

This is because kokushi (provincial governors) and kokuga (provincial government offices) utilized the jori naming method and handen map as the framework for land management and judgement of rights and obligations.

sen.j: また、12世紀以降の不入の権 (日本)を持つ荘園において、荘園内で完結する条里プランが存在したことも確認されており、官だけでなく民においても積極的に活用されていたことがわかる。
sen.e: In addition, it is confirmed that there existed plan of jori in shoen (manor in medieval Japan) with Funyu no ken (the right to keep the tax agents from entering the property) after the 12th centry that is concluded within shoen, which indicates that the plan was actively utilized both by public and private.

In addition, it is confirmed that there existed plan of jori in shoen (manor in medieval Japan) with Funyu no ken (the right to keep the tax agents from entering the property) after the 12th century that is concluded within shoen, which indicates that the plan was actively utilized both by public and private organizations.
sen.cmt: スペルミスがあります。また、「public and private」は、収まりが悪いので、「organizations」を加えました。
sen.e: In addition, it is confirmed that there existed plan of jori in shoen (manor in medieval Japan) with Funyu no ken (the right to keep the tax agents from entering the property) after the 12th century that is concluded within shoen, which indicates that the plan was actively utilized both by public and private organizations.

sen.j: 荘園制の衰退とともに条里呼称法も使用されなくなり、太閤検地以降は一部の地名に残るのみとなった。
sen.e: As the shoen system broke down, the jori naming system fell into disuse, and it remained only in some geographical names after Taiko-kenchi (the land survey by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI).
As the shoen system broke down, the jori naming system fell into disuse, and it remained only in some geographical names after Taiko-kenchi (the land survey by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI).
As the shoen system broke down, the jori naming system fell into disuse, and it remained only in some geographical names after Taiko-kenchi (the land survey by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI).

sen.j: 条里地割は多くの土地で残存した。
sen.e: Jori chiwari remained in many places.
Jori chiwari remained in many places.
Jori chiwari remained in many places.

sen.j: 人手による耕作が続く以上、既に存在する地割をあえて再整理する必要はなかったのである。
sen.e: As long as manual cultivation remained, there was no need to reorganize existing chiwari.
As long as manual cultivation remained, there was no need to reorganize existing chiwari.
As long as manual cultivation remained, there was no need to reorganize existing chiwari.

sen.j: ただし新田開発においては、条里呼称法に縛られることがなくなったため、条里に拠らない地割が一般的となった。
sen.e: However, when new rice fields were developed, chiwari that is not based on jori became common because the jori naming method was not binding any more.
However, when new rice fields were developed, chiwari that is not based on jori became common because the jori naming method was not binding any more.
However, when new rice fields were developed, chiwari that is not based on jori became common because the jori naming method was not binding any more.

sen.j: 明治時代になると、各地で田区改正が行なわれ、明治32年(1889年）には耕地整理法の制定がそれを加速した。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, revision of rice fields were done in various regions, and enactment of The Readjustment of Arable Land Act in 1889 accelerated it.
After the Meiji period, revision of rice fields were done in various regions, and enactment of The Readjustment of Arable Land Act in 1889 accelerated it.
After the Meiji period, revision of rice fields were done in various regions, and enactment of The Readjustment of Arable Land Act in 1889 accelerated it.

sen.j: 事業目的は大きく分けて土地区画整理と用排水路整備であったが、条里による整形区画の広がる西日本においては土地区画整理が必要でなく、実施例は一部の排水不良地に限られた。
sen.e: Business purposes were mainly land readjustment and improvement of irrigation channels and drainage, but in west Japan where regular sections by jori were pervasive, land readjustment was not required and enforcement was limited in some lands with poor drainage.

Business purposes were mainly land readjustment and improvement of irrigation channels and drainage, but in west Japan where regular sections by jori were pervasive, land readjustment was not required and enforcement was limited in some lands with poor drainage.

Business purposes were mainly land readjustment and improvement of irrigation channels and drainage, but in west Japan where regular sections by jori were pervasive, land readjustment was not required and enforcement was limited in some lands with poor drainage.

sen.j: 一方東日本では、条里地割の多くは河川の氾濫によって失われたり変形していた。
sen.e: In east Japan, on the other hand, many jori chiwari had been lost or deformed due to floods.
In east Japan, on the other hand, many jori chiwari had been lost or deformed due to floods.
In east Japan, on the other hand, many jori chiwari had been lost or deformed due to floods.

sen.j: このため河川の整備に伴う開墾・排水整備として行われた耕地整理は、条里とは無関係な地割となっている。
sen.e: Therefore, readjustment of agricultural lands performed as cultivation and improvement of drainage together with improvement of rivers were done independantly from jori.
Therefore, readjustment of agricultural lands performed as cultivation and improvement of drainage together with improvement of rivers were done independantly from jori.
Therefore, readjustment of agricultural lands performed as cultivation and improvement of drainage together with improvement of rivers were done independantly from jori.

sen.j: 1960年代に始まる圃場整備事業では、農地が30アール(30m x 100m)を基準に区画しなおされたため、多くの条里遺構が消滅した。
sen.e: In agricultural field improvement project that was started in the 1960s, farm lands were re-divided using 30 are (30m x 100m) as a unit, so many remains of jori were lost.
In agricultural field improvement project that was started in the 1960s, farm lands were re-divided using 30 are (30m x 100m) as a unit, so many remains of jori were lost.
In agricultural field improvement project that was started in the 1960s, farm lands were re-divided using 30 are (30m x 100m) as a unit, so many remains of jori were lost.

sen.j: 条里プランに基づく地割の遺構を、条里遺構と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Remains of chiwari based on the plan of jori are called jori remains.
Remains of chiwari based on the plan of jori are called jori remains.
Remains of chiwari based on the plan of jori are called jori remains.

sen.j: 条里遺構には、現在も耕地としてほぼそのままの形状が維持されているものと、地下に埋没しているものがある。
sen.e: Some jori remains are maintained as agricultural lands virtually unchanged even now, while others are buried underground.
Some jori remains are maintained as agricultural lands virtually unchanged even now, while others are buried underground.
Some jori remains are maintained as agricultural lands virtually unchanged even now, while others are buried underground.

sen.j: 埋没条里遺構を確認するには発掘の必要があるが、そうでない条里遺構は、専門家以外にも見つけることは可能である。
sen.e: To confirm buried jori remains, excavation is required, but it is possible for people other than specialists to find other jori remains.
To confirm buried jori remains, excavation is required, but it is possible for people other than specialists to find other jori remains.
To confirm buried jori remains, excavation is required, but it is possible for people other than specialists to find other jori remains.

sen.j: 歴史や地理への興味から、趣味として条里遺構を調べている人もいる。
sen.e: There are people who research jori remains as a hobby out of interest in history and geography.
There are people who research jori remains as a hobby out of interest in history and geography.
There are people who research jori remains as a hobby out of interest in history and geography.

sen.j: また、学生の学習・研究素材としても有効である。
sen.e: In addition, jori remains are effective as materials for study and research by students.
In addition, jori remains are effective as materials for study and research by students.
In addition, jori remains are effective as materials for study and research by students.

sen.j: 基本的には国土地理院発行2万5千分の1地図のような大縮尺の地図を使用する。
sen.e: Basically, use large scale maps such as 1/25,000 scale maps issued by Geographical Survey Institute.
Basically, use large scale maps such as 1/25,000 scale maps issued by Geographical Survey Institute.
Basically, use large scale maps such as 1/25,000 scale maps issued by Geographical Survey Institute.

sen.j: 透過紙などに、地図の縮尺に合わせて約109m相当の間隔で方格線を引き、地図に重ね合わせる。
sen.e: On transparent paper etc., draw grid lines with intervals equivalent to 109 meters according to the scale of the map, and put it on the map.
On transparent paper etc., draw grid lines with intervals equivalent to 109 meters according to the scale of the map, and put it on the map.
On transparent paper etc., draw grid lines with intervals equivalent to 109 meters according to the scale of the map, and put it on the map.

sen.j: 道路や水路・あぜ道などがある程度重なっていれば、条里遺構である蓋然性が高いと言える。
sen.e: If streets, ditches, or paths between rice fields align with the grid lines to some extent, it is highly probable to be jori remains.
sen.cmt: 「ある程度重なっていれば」の目的語として "grid lines" を補いました。
sen.e: If streets, ditches, or paths between rice fields align with the grid lines to some extent, it is highly probable to be jori remains.
If streets, ditches, or paths between rice fields align with the grid lines to some extent, it is highly probable to be jori remains.

sen.j: ただし、それらの道路や水路が完全な直線の場合はむしろ近年の地割と考えられる。
sen.e: However, if the streets and ditches are perfect straight lines, they are rather considered to be recent allocation.
However, if the streets and ditches are perfect straight lines, they are rather considered to be recent allocation.
However, if the streets and ditches are perfect straight lines, they are rather considered to be recent allocation.

sen.j: また、「七条」、「十里」、「一の坪」などの地名は条里呼称法に由来することが多く、条里の配列を復元する手がかりになる。
sen.e: Geographical names such as 'Shichijo,' 'Juri,' and 'Ichi no Tsubo' often stem from the jori naming system and give clue to restore jori arragement.
Geographical names such as 'Shichijo,' 'Juri,' and 'Ichi no Tsubo' often stem from the jori naming system and give clue to restore jori arragement.
Geographical names such as 'Shichijo,' 'Juri,' and 'Ichi no Tsubo' often stem from the jori naming system and give clue to restore jori arragement.
